name: Islamic Foundation of Nevada
mission: TO PROVICDE A HIGH QUALITY OF EDUCATION TO ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOL CHILDREN AND TO PROVIDE THE LOCAL COMMUNITY A BURIAL PLACE TO PRACTICE TRADIT...
theoryOfChange: By investing in educational access (scholarships) and leadership development (Cotillion/mentoring), the foundation aims to create a lasting impact for generations and build a more equitable community.
zakatClaimEvidence: No explicit mention of zakat acceptance for Islamic Foundation of Nevada was found in the provided search results. Search result [3] mentions "Ahlulbayt Center of Nevada | Zakat Foundation™" but then describes an Islamic center in Ireland, which is an international affiliate and not the specific US charity being evaluated.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 23/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; good program ratio (≥75%) suggests reasonable delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Separate restricted/endowment funds from operating reserves and publish a clear reserve-use policy.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: The Islamic Foundation of Nevada shows good impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: No explicit mention of zakat acceptance for Islamic Foundation of Nevada was found in the provided search results. Search result [3] mentions "Ahlulbayt Center of Nevada | Zakat Foundation™" but then describes an Islamic center in Ireland, which is an international affiliate and not the specific US charity being evaluated.

all_citations.claim: The organization provides elementary and secondary education and maintains a community burial place.
The foundation reported total revenue of $3,248,200, a program expense ratio of 75.5%, and 31.4 months of working capital.
The organization accepts general charitable donations and Sadaqah through various giving methods.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its strong financial health and efficient spending, though its total score is tempered by limited transparency and low data confidence.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public documentation regarding specific program outcomes
Low data confidence score due to sparse third-party verification

dimension_explanations.alignment: As a Sadaqah-eligible organization, it offers a medium fit for donors seeking to support religious infrastructure and local education [3]. The alignment score reflects its established role in the community, though it lacks the high-level transparency often sought by national donors [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a commitment to its mission by directing a 75.5% program expense ratio toward its educational and community programs [2]. While it maintains a robust 31.4 months of working capital, the lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data results in a medium impact score [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Foundation of Nevada provides essential educational services and community infrastructure for the local Muslim population.
strengths: Exceptional fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 31.4 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Foundation of Nevada is a religious and educational nonprofit that reported a total revenue of $3,248,200 [2]. The organization focuses on providing high-quality elementary and secondary education alongside maintaining community burial grounds and religious facilities [1][2].
